page.title: 14SW BASINGSTOKE: FAMILIES 2
page.content: Families play some games together on a wet day,like Monopoly or Scrabble.Most people have a holiday when they go away for 1 or 2 weeks. Staying in a caravan or tent or 'self-catering' at the seaside is popular. Quite a few people go abroad. Some people go to church on a Sunday, and children go to Sunday school. Mothers usually do the housework, cooking, cleaning and washing, but children often help with the washing up. Most homes have electric or gas cookers, and some have microwave ovens.Mum uses lots of gadgets to make jobs easier: vacuum cleaner, mixers and choppers. Fathers wash or repair their cars at the weekends. Some families have animals which they keep as pets in the house, like dogs, cats and hamsters.They are looked after by the family.
